alert.note: Alert for King; Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 1:03AM PST until March 02 at 8:06AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... White River At R Street Bridge affecting King and Pierce Counties. .An atmospheric river will continue to bring moderate to heavy rainfall to the area into Tuesday morning before the axis of heaviest moisture shifts south. This will keep area rivers on the rise through at least Tuesday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...White River At R Street Bridge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM PST Monday the flow was 7850.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 PM PST Monday was 8230.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7803.8 cfs late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood flow is 7500.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 900 AM PST.
